alert.note: Alert for Park (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 3:45AM MDT until June 14 at 12:05PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs affecting Park County. .Heavy rain falling on the snowpack over the southern Beartooth/Absaroka mountains has resulted in unprecedented rises on the Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs. The river is currently higher than it has been since 1918 and continues to rise. How far above flood stage the Yellowston River will rise is hard to determine due to uncertainties with the rain falling on the snow in the high country. As a result the forecast crest should be used as a starting point and not a definite peak. If you live or are recreating near the river move to higher ground, and expect higher water levels than have previously been experienced. The flood waters will continue to move downstream impacting Livingston today. Additional updates to the river forecast and warning will be updated as more information becomes available. For the Yellowstone River...including Corwin Springs and Livingston...A Flood of Record is possible. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs. * WHEN...From early this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, The river has reached bankfull with flooding of brushland and prairie along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM MDT Monday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 AM MDT Monday was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain above flood stage with a maximum value of 11.6 feet this afternoon. It will fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 06/14/1918. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Yellowstone River Corwin Spring 11.0 11.3 Mon 2 am 10.6 7.8 7.3 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks, they can collapse and drop you into the flood waters. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Safety message...A river Flood Warning means river flooding is expected to impact people and property in the warned area. Prepare for flooding impacts associated with the forecast river levels in your location. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued bythis afternoon at 500 PM MDT.
